XX is one of the top dairy products manufacturers in Asia.
The company is preparing a financial plan for the coming year and has
the following new milk products under consideration

Initial investment : $25millions

Internal rate of return: 13%

Risk adjustment factor : -3%


Since the risks associated with the new product is different, a risk
adjustment factor (RAF) has been assigned to new product in order
to adjust the required rate of return from the firm’s cost of capital. XX’s cost of capital (WACC) is currently 15%.
The chief financial officer of the company estimates that the earnings
after tax (EAT) in this financial year will be $40 million. XX has 6 million ordinary shares outstanding, and the board would like to maintain a debt-to-equity ratio (D/E) of 4.
